reviews.review:
Half-Life: Source is half-baked and woefully in need of a hefty extra dash of Source. 

It's a shame. Pushed to pick my Desert Island PC game, I'd sadly set aside the likes of Deus Ex and Combat Mission in favour of the orginal Half-Life. It was an astonishing development in the art of video gaming and there's been nothing quite like it since in terms of story-telling flair, variety and visceral excitement.

Applying "Source technology" to Half-Life should, therefore, have been a masterstroke.

Sadly not. It looks barely any different.

Here's what to do: forget Half-Life: Source, download the Black Mesa remake, and prepare to be astonished all over again...

Está bien, lo unico nuevo que agregaron fue el sistema Source, lo cual me parece perfecto, ademas el agua se ve hermosa como siempre. Lo malo es que sigue siendo los mismos graficos, tampoco hay muchos mods para disfrutar, pero sigue siendo un buen juego solo que este la version del Half Life 1 con el sistema Source no se empeñaron mucho.

メニューが日本語化されているだけ。日本語化MODがあるがバージョンアップのため不可能。日本語で、ストーリーが楽しみたいという人は本家Half-lifeを購入しよう。
ゲーム自体は悪くありません。正直言って楽しいです。
I can't remember why I played this so much.

Half-Life: Source is practically no different than the original 1998 Half-Life. Ultimately, the difference comes down to more polygons, somewhat smoother animations, slightly better physics (enemies just ragdoll on death here, no predetermined animation) and shiny things. Water is also better, but the nature of this game is that it's still apparent that the game is old. However it holds up to the old standard, and the price tag is much better since you also get the Deathmatch Source game with it.
Great game. Instant classic, still like to play it after playing it 10 times over. Can't wait till the revamp, Black Mesa Source is completed.
Just buy Black Mesa

Qué decir de este juego? El mejor FPS de la historia de los videojuegos, adelantado 10 años a su tiempo. El primer FPS donde el guión de verdad importaba y de verdad te dejaba con ganas de seguir adelante para ver qué es lo que pasaría a continuación!

Gráficos perfectos en su época, buen doblaje, una jugabilidad endiablada...un juego que te hacía sentir parte del universo creado por Valve...

Si no lo has jugado nunca, no sé a qué esperas, te pierdes una de las mejores experiencias que puedes vivir como gamer.

10/10

Old, but gold, is the phrase I would use. It might seem lame in this day and age, but if you've never played it before I'd recommend playing it just because it's one of the classics.

Also because you should get a sense of the plot that leads up to Half-Life 2.

This is a classic FPS. I don't like most modern FPSes (I'm looking at you, Call of Duty), but I LOVED this game. If you even slightly like the FPS genre, BUY THIS!

I love this game. If your a person who has respect for older games, grew up with older games, or are looking for a FPS action game set in the future with FRIKKIN' ZOMBIE ALIENS, this is for you. By far, one of the best games I have ever played.

Hated how valve changed the weapons in the Half Life 1 copy,also sold on steam. I found Half Life source,and was happy to discover the weapons had the classic models,Also,Rode the tram at the beggining of the game for roughly 8 minutes,10/10

If you don't own Half Life already, then get this game.
if you do have the original half life, don't get this. Because it's the same just with ragdolls and better lighting

Half-Life gilt ja als echter Klassiker unter den PC Spielen, als ich es nun zum ersten Mal spielte war ich schlichtweg begeistert. Die Story mit ihrer Atmosphäre hat mich einfach so gefesselt, dass ich oft nicht aufhören konnte zu spielen, da es solch einen Spaß gemacht hat und ich immer wissen wollte wie es weitergeht.

In Half-Life spielen wir Gordon Freeman der bei einem wissenschaftlichem Experiment teilnimmt, als nun ein Problem auftritt, öffnet sich ein Portal zu einer anderen Welt. Kurz darauf müssen wir uns durch etliche Laboreinrichtungen kämpfen und uns mit Soldaten sowie Aliens auseinandersetzen. 

Half-Life Source bietet dem Spieler einen echt grandiosen Spielspaß und gehört eigentlich in jede Sammlung eines Gamers.

Meine Wertung: 9,5/10
Not much of an update on the original, stick with the original.
un juegazo es desafiante,adictivo y repleto de accion para mi el fps

Half-Life: Source is an awful port of Half-Life to the Source engine. There is literally no reason to play this over the original Half-Life.

The only pro to Half-Life: Source is that you can use it in Garry's Mod if you really really want too.

Nerd Simulator: Source

In Half-Life, you play a desperate whiteboy vrigin who embarks on an interdimensional journey to get laid.

You start the game as Gordon Freeman, an anti-social loser who's an ordinary scientist at Black Mesa, when suddenly things take a turn for the worst, and it's time for the geek to face his bully.  Gordon is faced with overwhelming odds as he is forced to finally interact with other beings.  His first instinct, grab a crowbar and start killing things.  The standard mindset of any internet dwelling whiteboy.

Avoid at all costs.
+ Black Mesa

Everything is note perfect, great story, gripping action, and very, very fun.

10/10.

More like the original half life than the updated Gold SRC version.

Fantastic game. I first encountered the Half-Life series in 2008 with the 'Orange Box' on Xbox 360, at which point I was hooked on HL2. Recently downloaded steam again and decided to give the original a go. Despite the 1998 graphics the story is immense and it's easy to see why it was so popular. Well worth playing, I may even run through it a second time!

Half LIfe is a great game, however, Valve did a sloppy job converting it to source. All of the models still retain their goldsrc materials and models, except now they have ragdoll physics. Also, thanks to the change of physics, there are certain parts that are harder to navigate. For example, in the chapter "Blast Pit" where you have to move the crates over the electrified water spill,  the crates hardly move at all thx to the source physics, making it almost guarenteed you'll be shocked.

You're much better off playing Black Mesa Source.
osta tää vielä paramki alkuperänen ja alkuperänenkin on jo ihan 6/5
With the improved engine, HD pack, and of course Half-Life, this game really is something. If you've never experienced the Half-Life series then I suggest you start with this game!

Y... si estas viendo esto, significa que tenes steam, y si tenes steam significa que tenes que jugar al half life, y si no tenes el half life, significa que tenes que tener el half life source.. totalmente mejorado, y el clasico de siempre. Vamos por mas Valve!!!!

This game changed FPS games forever. If you haven't played Half-Life, do yourself a favor and buy it right now. This version is the same fun experience as the original game, but ported to the Source engine for slightly better graphics and ragdoll effects. Seriously, Half-Life is pure awesome. And remember, if it wasn't for this game, none of us would be using Steam right now! Not to mention that killing headcrabs, zombies, and bullsquids really is hours of fun. I rate this game 10/10.
游戏内容是不错，但是有3D眩晕症的人最好还是不要碰！！！

Too many bugs and glitches, invisible weapons (I HAVE verified the files, still doesn't work), no reloading sound.  The game is still playable, for sure, but I'm really disappointed.  Just gonna download the original and play that instead. :(

Half-Life вышел на 15 лет назад ,но это серия и игра до сих пор пользуется популярностью,
и 1 июня 2004 вышло переиздание с HD качестве и великолепным движком Source.
Сюжет повестует нам как Гордон Фримен  - молодой талантливый научный сотрудник проводил эксперемент ,и произошла катастрофа.
Как не странно мне было скучно проходить эту игру ,наверное из-за графы,звуков,музыки,экшена или эффектов .
Ни какого удовольствия ,но если я прошёл  13 - 10 лет назад когда не было всего что сейчас есть,но я могу сказать кое-что об игре.
В HD графике ,люди кажутся стражным ,бледными.
В игре нету катсцен ,ты подходишь к людям и они говорят ,а ты можешь в это время ходить - весь сюжет идёт вокруг тебя
,а молчание Гордона придаёт погружение в мир Half-Life.
Вода очень реалистичная ,и очень выделятся из текстур.
Не могу поставить оценку ,так если бы я прошёл её в то время, я бы думал иначе.
Советую ТОЛЬКО олдфагам.

Very interesting revamp of the original Half-Life. Sounds are greatly improved and graphic textures are similar to that found in Half-Life 2. It was fun playing through it again after so many years with a little bit of aesthetic improvement to back the classic storyline of Gordon Freeman.

If you enjoyed the original Half-Life and would like even better graphics than this, check out Black Mesa online. It is a complete remake of the original with modern graphics and enough of a game-flow change to make the maps familiar yet new and refreshing.

This game's worth it to play for the nostalgia, but it is showing its age and it's also incredibly difficult compared to Half-Life 2 and beyond. It can feel pretty slow at times, because the environments aren't super engrossing or anything; however, if you've got about 6-8 hours of game time to spare, spend it honoring this classic that started it all.

Если вы хотите сыграть в обновленный Half-Life на современной системе, но не можете выбрать между Source-версией и Black Mesa, я советую выбирать второй вариант, так как его единственный минус – отсутствие пяти последних уровней. В Source-версии отличительными от оригинала особенностями являются интерфейс в стиле сиквела, более детализированные старые текстуры (вода абсолютно новая), поправки в AI и… вырезанный мультиплеер, доступный как отдельная игра. По большей части H-L:S кажется лишь модификацией…

7/10

I’m going to recommend Half Life: Source to modern gamers but just barely. I never played it nor Half Life 2 back in the day, so I am completely unbiased by nostalgia. Both games have intrigued me for years, though, and I saw them together in a Steam sale bundle so decided to pick them up and finally play through them. The original Half Life looks quite dated and is missing many modern FPS creature comforts we have come to take for granted, but still shines thanks to its brilliant & pioneering design.

Yes, it was state of the art when it came out and a truly groundbreaking game for its time. But is it fun to play now? When I first fired the game up my initial thought was, “I can’t do this. It’s too old.” The polygon models are harsh, even in Source version. People’s hands look sharp enough to poke your eye out. The sound is downright terrible in some places. Environments are often sparse with low-res textures. It can also be difficult to tell whether or not you are damaging certain enemies.

Despite all that, I took a break and came back to it. I’m happy to say I got hooked shortly afterward. Half Life is made so well, I was able to overlook its technical shortcomings and get immersed in Gordon’s flight from Black Mesa. The pace is frenetic, rarely giving you the chance to catch your breath. It’s a very intelligent shooter, also. There are many hidden areas, multiple paths, clever puzzles, and neat surprise moments along the way. You keep moving almost continuously to the very mysterious ending.

Which brings me to why I almost gave the title a thumbs down. The ending is deeply unsatisfying. After everything that happened I still only had the vaguest idea of what was going on. I think there was an accident in the lab that led to an alien invasion, with either the gov’t or privately contracted troops trying to destroy the entire facility to cover it up. And then, dude in suit with briefcase in the interdimensional train car. The end.

I have started Half Life 2 and while I love it so far, in terms of story it adds even more confusion to the narrative. Gordon Freeman is one of the most incurious people in the universe, never once pausing to ask anybody, “Hey, WTF is happening!?!?” I’m hoping more light gets shed on the plot as I progress through the sequel. You can only tease people for so long before they get bored.

From a pure gameplay standpoint, though, Half Life: Source will not disappoint. If you have never played it and can deal with outdated graphics & sound, go ahead & pick it up. If not, you can skip straight to Half Life 2 without missing a whole lot. In other words, you’ll be just as confused at the beginning of HL2 whether you played through the first game or not.
ааааааааааааааа!!1
The one that started the Half-life saga! Fight the military and xen aliens, and venture deep into the "catacombs" of black mesa.

Basically this is a version of the original Half-Life game with some updated graphics and the ability to pick what chapter you start on. Simple as that so the only real reason to get it is if you buy the Half-Life complete pack that includes this. 

Alternatively if you are just searching out a play through of Half-Life this is not a bad choice because you can play it with better graphics.

There's not much to say about this great game that isn't already known. The story is probably one of the best from the history of videogames, and Half-Life is like a beacon to every FPS that came after. The Source game engine brings even more enjoyability to this great game, and i think everyone that loves this kind of game should try this at least once.
I advice to leave it in your wish list and try buying it in a promotion, and if you could get it in a pack with the other games from the Half-Life series, even better.
Congratulations to Valve for this great work, in one word: a Masterpiece.
I love the ragdoll physics in this version 10/10

I like Half Life. It is one of my all time favourite FPS games. I believe it is because of Half Life why I really came to like this genre. I have been collecting FPS games ever since. 

I hate its Source conversion. Why? Because it is not a full conversion but simply an enhanced version with the Source engine's features. You have better water effects and you also have better shaders, lighting, shadows, etc.

But essentially, it is the same as the vanilla version was. If you do not use high-res textures in a room then using modern water effects makes the game look strange. You can easily see how these things cannot work together.

Black Mesa is a much better way to relive the experience Half Life gave us 15 years ago. It is a total conversion of Half Life and what is more important: it is free. Download and install that one or simply reinstall the vanilla game again.
they have kept the feel of the original game sbut with the source engine its damn good!

Este es un juego que disfrutaras, tanto si ya jugaste el original o si no lo has hecho!

Classic.

Classic. If you haven't given it a try, you _really_ should (and also the sequel). Fun shooter with platforming and puzzles, good story set up and ending. I give this 4.5 stars out of 5.  (1= Bad, stay away; 2= not recommended; 3= average; 4=I liked this, you should try it; 5=One of my all time favorites). The only thing that keeps this from being a 5 is probably the fact it isn't Half Life 2. :D

살면서 이런 명작게임 한번쯤은 해봐야하지 않을까요
10/10

As of today 2/27 this game is weird. It seems buggy as heck

I dont really understand, from what Im reading the game was fine when it came out? But now its near completely broken I think. There are glitches EVERYWHERE and other weird going ons. I don't really understand how Valve could have broken so much in this game with updates?

Technically speaking there are supposed to be very little changes, controls feel like you would expect in Source and are good and accurate when compared to how the old GoldSrc games control today which can take some getting used to but isn't bad. The way everything is rendered and shaders are diffrent, things look a bit more crisp but all models and textures are old. They actually look uglier to me than the standard HL1 non-hd models which I feel are the best to me visually. Ragdolls are added but thats really the only physics addition. Everything else from gibs to med packs uses the old HL1 physics where it simply falls or for gibs bounces and bounces. The water looks nice but does not fit in when everything around it looks cartoony. It ruins the dam scene for me atleast. Also they made some small changes in areas that I wasn't a huge fan of, mostly just looks related stuff and nothing big or something worth whining about. But of all the ports of HL1 I have played, which is only the PS2 and Source port, I like this one less. Atleast the PS2 version was objectively better than the original on PC when it came out in 2001. The orignal was released in '98. The Source port came out in 2004 and has none of the new content found in the PS2 version including the Coop expansion, Half Life Decay. I have not touched the Dreamcast version nor have I ever owned or played the Dreamcast aside from maybe one time at a family friends...maybe..its been probably near a decade since that. I also have not played the Linux or Mac ports but honestly I have no reason to ever want to us Mac OS. Linux is gaining ground though.Also the expansions are not present. Just basic Half Life 1.

Present in this current version there is a huge problem with hit boxes on tanks, helicopters, and enemies of that type. The Gonarch also seemed to not take damage alot of the time when I was hitting it. Its just iffy and I want to say broken. Also with source some of the design decisions that were taken with Half Life 1 just seem awful. Vorts never missing even though it feels like your moving like Speedy Gonzalez just feels like bs and Xen still sucks. Yeah, Xen always sucks. I hate it so much until you get closer to the end and fight the nihlanth/final boss.

But Half Life is still half life and its still fun. But this just isn't better in any way than the original aside from a few negligible graphics points. 

Black Mesa Source is what this game should have been, except for the fact that they did change alot of the game and removed some points and added others. This game should have just been Half Life but graphically updated with some small gameplay upgrades. Its just not what it should have been and falls short of the original.

Graphics better than Cryisis 3

Story line not as good as Call of Duty: Ghost Multiplayer

9/10

1v1 is pretty good in the game too.
Try it out with a friend.
I don't know how I racked up 20 hours in this game but hey, I did it, so I must like something in this game.

I have played the game for about 2 hours now. This is probably the first time since the late 90's/early 00's since I have played the original Half-life. Its amazing how well the game still holds up to this day. Its easily much more fun then most shooters on the market, and I would argue that its also better then Half-Life 2. 

As for the changes in this verison, the game comes with the HD pack that originally shipped with the Blue-Shift expansion pack, and improved ragdoll (did the original even have ragdoll?), as well as realistic water and slightly better lightning. Explosions sprites have also been replaced with half-life 2 like explosions. Overall I would say this game is considerably better then the original Half-life. 

I would also like to mention that this game is worht playing even if you have Black mesa. The reason is that the game just feels so much different then black mesa does. The graphic style is completely different. You can't really compare the 2. Overall I am giving this a 9/10.
Все те саме але із шейдерами від Source
Juego muy bueno para el cual no pasan los años
Classic! Still a bundle of joy even with the aged graphics.

The granddaddy of them all.

Newer gamers might have a hard time visualizing how revolutionary this game was at the time, but it was one of the first truly narrative-driven FPS in gaming history. What's truly surprising is how well the game holds up - level design has aged somewhat (lots of corridors. LOTS of corridors), but the standards established in this game are still quite present today.

This version of the game has been updated to use the Source engine for effects and physics, as well as the water modeling, so it's the best version of the game to purchase if you're looking for the best experience.

Words cannot express how much you should own this game. It's as close to a mandatory purchase as you can get in gaming.

A mio parere Half Life era già di per sè stupendo anche se datato graficamente. Questa nuova versione corregge il "difetto" della versione precedente arrivando quasi alla stregua della texture di Half Life 2; personalmente non posso chiedere di più

You play a geek. An ass-kicking geek. An ass-kicking geek with a rad ponytail. Buy this.

What can be said about Half Life?  A hella lot.   Ages after its time, its still a shining example of what solid FPS games should offer.   Without placing all the glory on gun fights, it instead challenges the mind with often simple, and sometimes not, mazes and obstacles, that most run n' guns today have forgotten all about.

This game is simply amazing, even all these years later.

this is a very good game. this game may have some difficult parts but it is still the first great game of the half life series
Valve has truely made this and the other Half-Lifes my favorite games ever. The story and gameplay are the best. 10/10.

Quinto gioco preferito: Non me lo aspettavo, sul serio. è davvero bello per quell'epoca, la grafica non è così male, ma soprattutto ciò che ti fa innamorare di questo gioco è il gameplay. Una trama semplice e ben strutturata. purtroppo se non ti giochi bene la vita rischi di non riuscire a superare alcuni punti. Comunque FANTASTICO!
The original Hλlf-Life with Source engine!
The controls are really fast! You often overshoot what you wanted. It's and old game and it shows in the graphics, but it is still fun to play.
I would highly recommend this great game if you loved Half-Life 1 then you'll love it redone with the source engine.

If you want to play HL in the source engine, than this is THE version for you! They don't realy change to much of the game. But some graphical things are pretty much improved. Some puzzles also include a brand new twist because of Source's physics engine. The body's are now fully dynamic and so is the flashlight. You're now able to add motion blur and other new graphical stuff that makes the game look a lot better. They also keep the tone and mood from the first game by including all of the original textures. But some of the sounds (Like the foodsteps) are directly from HL2 witch makes the game sound alot better. And if you're a fan of the HD content the original Half-Life had, they included all of those moddels into this version. Witch makes it look even better. So if you're a HL fan, this game will stand nicely in your game library.

p.s: Sorry for my english. Its not my main language.

This game is what started it all. The game is amazing and has really nice shooting mechanics and the graphics were great for the time. Highly recommended if you haven't already played it
Unless you need props for Gmod, stick with the original Half life.

Shooters don't typically age as well as other genres, but this game still holds up as an amazing experience in 2014. Half-Life is simply one of the most innovative shooters of all time, and any serious gamer should play this piece of history. Highly recommended.
